metadata.title: CVE-2021-3601 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible
metadata.description:
** REJECT ** DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER. ConsultIDs: none. Reason:This candidate was withdrawn by its CNA. OpenSSL does not class this issueas a security vulnerability. The trusted CA store should not containanything that the user does not trust to issue other certificates. Notes:https://github.com/openssl/openssl/issues/5236#issuecomment-1196460611

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3601` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.1.1f-1ubuntu2.4
openssl - 1.1.1f-1ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.1f-1ubuntu2.4').
